dcterms:description: The dataset consists of training and testing sets for three languages: English, German and Spanish, as well as a French test set for cross-lingual CWI. The goal was to predict which words could be difficult for an anon-native speaker, based on annotations collected from a mixture of native and non-native speakers.
dcterms:title: Complex Word Identification Shared Task 2018

dcterms:creator: Seid Muhie Yimam
Sanja EStajner
Martin Riedl
Chris Biemann
dcterms:description: The English dataset consists of a mixture of professionally written news (News), non-professionally written news (WikiNews), and Wikipedia articles (Wiki).
dcterms:title: English Dataset

dcterms:creator: Seid Muhie Yimam
Sanja EStajner
Martin Riedl
Chris Biemann
dcterms:description: The German dataset contains data taken from German Wikipedia pages, annotated by 10 people, a mixture of native and non-native speakers.
dcterms:title: German Dataset

dcterms:creator: Seid Muhie Yimam
Sanja EStajner
Martin Riedl
Chris Biemann
dcterms:description: The Spanish dataset contains data taken from Spanish Wikipedia pages, annotated by 10 people, a mixture of native and non-native speakers.
dcterms:title: Spanish Dataset

dcterms:creator: Seid Muhie Yimam
Sanja EStajner
Martin Riedl
Chris Biemann
dcterms:description: The French dataset includes data from French Wikipedia pages, annotated by 10 people, a mixture of native and non-native speakers.
dcterms:title: French Dataset
